subject: Technology
title: Regulating Big Tech: Can Governments Keep Up?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Regulating Big Tech: Can Governments Keep Up?.

hook.text: In a congressional hearing, a senator asked Mark Zuckerberg how Facebook makes money. The answer is ads. He didn't know.

buildup.text: Governments struggle to regulate technology they don't understand. Laws take years while platforms evolve in months.

discovery.text: The EU's Digital Services Act requires platforms to explain their algorithms and take responsibility for harmful content.

twist.text: Tech companies spend billions lobbying against regulation. They argue that rules will stifle innovation and free speech.

climax.text: The debate between innovation and regulation will define whether technology serves people or exploits them.

punchline.text: Technology moves at light speed. Regulation moves at government speed.

quiz.question: What does the EU's Digital Services Act require of platforms?
options: They must pay users for their data
They must explain their algorithms and take responsibility for harmful content
They must shut down within the EU
